column4: if i'm trying to burn a ubuntu iso from serpentine do i go to create photo cd
right clicking on it won't work
says i need to insert a cd with at least 698 mb when i put a 700mb cd in
can i compress the ubuntu iso?
will it still work if i try to boot up from it
how do i burn it so i can get the new ubuntu installed?
the ubuntu iso is already compressed..
right click the iso and write to cd
even if it says 701 meg free. it will still work
You dont need nautilus to burn..
You can get nautilus by typing it in a terminal/cli
Insert a blank cd.. they usually say 700 meg on them anyhow...  next.. right click the *.iso and select write to dick.
do they have any number on them like 650 or 700..
Are you sure there is nothing already on those cd's
I need to ask a dumb question, are you sure you have the shiny sude down.
then there is no reason they will not work
